item.title: Design Like DaVinci -- SXSW 2013
item.description: In this talk, you will learn about five sketching secrets of Leonardo Da Vinci, four rules for generating ideas, and four rules for refining ideas. I call these lessons from Leonardo. You might find a few stories about Leonardo Da Vinci that you did not know.
item.content:encoded: In this talk, you will learn about five sketching secrets of Leonardo Da Vinci, four rules for generating ideas, and four rules for refining ideas. I call these lessons from Leonardo. You might find a few stories about Leonardo Da Vinci that you did not know.

item.title: How to Get Facebook Fans: 10 Killer Ways the Bond Way
item.description: A lonely Facebook fan page is bad for business. But how do you get more Facebook fans to see it and like it? See my top 10 ways to attract more Facebook fans - what would James Bond do? style. Mentioned in the deck: "Mommy, Where Does Traffic Come From?" traffic report: http://www.trafficgenerationcafe.com/increase-website-traffic/ Traffic Generation Café on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/TrafficGenerationCafe Remember to SUBSCRIBE to my Slideshare channel; don’t miss another great presentations! Ana Hoffman

item.title: Think Different like Steve Jobs: Leadership and Innovation by Peter Fisk
item.description: What can you learn from Steve Jobs? How could you change your world? ... Peter Fisk explores how to think different about leadership and innovation ... inspired by Apple and its founder, the theme is now available as an inspiring keynote speech, and practical two-day masterclass ... email peterfisk@peterfisk.com for more information.

item.title: Data Makes Your Content Harder, Better, Faster, and Stronger
item.description: Presented at DistilledLive Seattle on March 5, 2012. With the continued adoption of content marketing as a strategy, many companies will soon find themselves in the middle of a content arms race. Kane discusses how to use both internal and external data to differentiate and rise above everyday content, and move beyond the usual data-based tactics like infographics.
item.content:encoded: Presented at DistilledLive Seattle on March 5, 2012. With the continued adoption of content marketing as a strategy, many companies will soon find themselves in the middle of a content arms race. Kane discusses how to use both internal and external data to differentiate and rise above everyday content, and move beyond the usual data-based tactics like infographics.

item.title: Simple Design
item.description: March’s Slideshare offering is all about visual design. Learn why simplicity takes work, why it’s best to pair one idea with one slide, why unity matters, why pictures are superior, how losing signal can lose your audience, and a simple method for eliminating slide fluff
item.content:encoded: March’s Slideshare offering is all about visual design. Learn why simplicity takes work, why it’s best to pair one idea with one slide, why unity matters, why pictures are superior, how losing signal can lose your audience, and a simple method for eliminating slide fluff

item.title: A Primer on Big Data for Business
item.description: "Big Data" is a term as ubiquitous as data itself, but it is more than just a way to describe the massive amount of information created every day. In fact, I would argue that it is more of a dynamic than a one-dimensional term. In this presentation, I walk business audiences through the history and rise of big data, the four Vs of big Data, and end by looking at some practical applications and recommendations. Originally presented on February 26, 2013 in Washington, DC at the US Chamber of Commerce.
item.content:encoded: "Big Data" is a term as ubiquitous as data itself, but it is more than just a way to describe the massive amount of information created every day. In fact, I would argue that it is more of a dynamic than a one-dimensional term. In this presentation, I walk business audiences through the history and rise of big data, the four Vs of big Data, and end by looking at some practical applications and recommendations. Originally presented on February 26, 2013 in Washington, DC at the US Chamber of Commerce.

item.title: Meet Mat Ngo - [Visual Resume] - @mathewngo
item.description: Aloha I am Mat with one [ T ] not 2. I hope you like my visual resume! [With so many real estate agents to choose from in Honolulu, what sets Mathew Ngo apart from the rest? Mathew Ngo focuses on building long term relationship with his clients. Ensuring that all Mathew’s clients receive his personal touch in every transaction is of the utmost importance. Mathew communicates with his clients on a regular basis and updates them on all facets of his work for them. Mathew knows Honolulu, and surrounding neighborhoods, and familiarizes himself with the fast changing marketplace and provides the latest technologies to promote his sales locally and on the mainland. Mathew’s focus is purely on the client’s needs and wants, and delivers with the utmost precision. His unique ability to listen and understand your needs and desire, and even fears, is why Mathew is proving to be one of most valuable agents on Oahu.]
